III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care institutions;
Title initial treatment plan.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4155
Section (3) The initial treatment plan shall include all of the following:
Description (i) For youth 14 years of age and over, a plan to prepare the
youth for functional independence.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff are not helping Youth A on the cusp of 18 prepare for their
next life transitions.
Investigation Complainant was called on March 12, 2024, and I received a
recording saying, “the number cannot be completed as
dialed.” The number from the complainant was checked to
ensure the correct number was dialed. There was no other
contact method left by the complainant.
Program Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility
on March 13, 2024. Program Manager reported Youth A is on
track to graduate high school this year and attends Michigan
Youth Opportunity Initiative, MYOI. Program Manager described
having a meeting in February with Youth A and Youth A’s foster
care worker to discuss Youth A moving to an independent living
(IL) program. Program Manager stated the worker reported she
would look for an IL program for Youth A once Youth A was
behavior free for three to six months. Program Manager reported
Youth A has been doing well being behavior free and was on
course to move to an IL program.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
March 13, 2024. Supervisor reported Youth A has turned her
behavior around and is doing well at the facility. Supervisor stated
Youth A is completing E20 through Belleville High School which is
a career skill credit recovery program that is self-paced allowing
Youth A to make up work she missed to gain credits she is
missing. Supervisor described Youth A as working hard in school
and at the facility to have enough credits to graduate at the end of
the school year. Supervisor stated Youth A cooks dinner with
2

staff, works on budgeting, goes grocery shopping with a budget,
and recently had a job until Youth A’s poor choices and behaviors
made it so Youth A could not continue her employment.
Supervisor reported Youth A is involved in MYOI. Supervisor
stated the facility is doing all they can to prepare Youth A to
transition out of the facility into her next placement.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
13, 2024. Youth A described being involved in MYOI, being on
target to graduate at the end of the school year and exploring the
option of attending Western Michigan University. Youth A
reported the facility has helped with budgeting money, and
reminding her she is older and to stay out of situations with her
peers at the facility. Youth A stated she wished the facility could
help get her drivers permit but she is not allowed to drive any of
the facility’s vehicles. Youth A reported she feels the facility is
doing what they can to help her transition to her next placement.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
13, 2024. Youth B described being at the facility for just over one
year. Youth B stated she works on life skills at the facility
including budgeting, cooking, cleaning, managing her emotions
and working on proper hygiene with staff.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
13, 2024. Staff 1 described leading groups at night when she is
on shift and reported last night’s group was about independent
living and skills needed to live on your own. Staff 1 stated she has
led groups for the youth discussing career goals and how life skills
relate to one’s career goals. Staff 1 reported the facility does
whatever they can to help each youth be successful when they
leave the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
13, 2024. Youth C reported feeling safe at the facility and not
having any concerns with staff.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
13, 2024. Youth D described liking the program and the facility “a
lot.” Youth D stated staff are “nice and do a lot to help us.”
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
13, 2024. Youth E described staff leading groups nightly at the
facility. Youth E stated the groups are about life skills, jobs, what
is going on at the facility and many other topics. Youth E reported
3

staff can help her prepare for when she leaves but it will be up to
the judge as to where she goes once, she is discharged.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on March 18, 2024.
Staff 2 described talking with Youth A about transitioning from the
program and what she will need to be successful. Staff 2 stated
staff facilitate groups on independent living skills to help prepare
the youth for when they leave. Staff 2 reported the facility is doing
all they can to help Youth A transition out of the program and be
successful at Youth A’s next placement.
Documents Reviewed:
• Email from Youth A’s Foster Care Worker dated 3/19/2024
stating Youth A is participating in MYOI, tutoring/homework
lab after school and counseling. Foster Care Worker did
not indicate having any concerns with IL preparation for
Youth A.
• Email from Youth B’s Foster Care Worker dated 3/12/2024
stating she has no concerns at all with the facility.
• Documentation for Work Conversations, Group Progress
Notes, Goal Exploration, court reports, treatment plans, and
transition plan for Youth A from 10/12/23 through 1/29/24
documenting multiple activities, groups, meetings and skills
the facility is doing to help prepare Youth A for when she
leaves the facility.
Analysis Documentation shows the facility is doing various activities to
prepare Youth A for transitioning out of the program. Youth A and
Foster Care Worker did not report any concerns with the facility
not doing what they could to help prepare Youth A for her next
placement. The facility is found in compliance.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or discriminatory
language including negative references to a youth’s background
or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation are strictly prohibited.
4

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff come into the facility and talk inappropriately about the youth
and yell in their faces.
Investigation Complainant was called on March 12, 2024, and I received a
recording saying, “the number cannot be completed as
dialed.” The number from the complainant was checked to
ensure the correct number was dialed. There was no other
contact method left by the complainant.
Program Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility
on March 13, 2024. Program Manager denied being aware of
any staff talking inappropriately about the youth or yelling in
youths’ faces. Program Manager stated there have not been any
youth who have brought up this concern to her or any other staff
that she is aware of.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
March 13, 2024. Supervisor denied being aware of any staff
talking inappropriately about youth or yelling in youths’ faces.
Supervisor stated there have not been any youth who have come
to her stating these concerns. Supervisor stated staff can be
direct and firm at times when giving youth direction or holding
youth accountable for their behavior and some youth view that as
being yelled at by staff.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
13, 2024. Youth A described some of the staff at the facility as
“rude” and not allowing youth to do anything fun. Youth A
reported Staff 2 says things like, “girl this, girl that,” and it irritates
Youth A. Youth A denied any staff yelling in youths’ faces. Youth
A described Staff 2 once saying she was glad a certain youth had
left the facility. Youth A could not recall when Staff 2 said this, if
other people heard Staff 2 say this or who Staff 2 was talking
about when Staff 2 made the comment.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
13, 2024. Youth B reported she feels safe at the facility. Youth B
denied seeing or hearing about any staff yelling at youth or talking
inappropriately about youth who have left the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
13, 2024. Staff 1 denied ever seeing a staff yell at a youth or say
inappropriate comments about a youth who has left the facility.
Staff 1 reported staff may raise their voice after asking multiple
times for a youth to do something when the youth has been
5

refusing, but never yell at a youth. Staff 1 stated she does not
have any concerns with her coworkers’ interactions with youth.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
13, 2024. Youth C reported feeling safe at the facility and not
having any concerns with staff yelling at youth or making
inappropriate comments about youth who have left the facility.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
13, 2024. Youth D described liking the program and the facility “a
lot.” Youth D stated staff are “nice and do a lot to help us.” Youth
D reported Staff 2 has told youth what they are doing is “childish.”
Youth D described the time Staff 2 has made this comment is
when youth are doing “dumb things.” Youth D reported she minds
her own business and does not know what goes on with the other
youth in the facility.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
13, 2024. Youth E reported most of the staff are nice. Youth E
described Staff 2 as being rude and disrespectful. Youth E stated
when Staff 2 took the youths to a Piston’s basketball game Staff 2
“hit” Youth E. Youth E reported being in the passenger seat of the
van and talking negatively about her own mom. Youth E
described Staff 2 placing her hand on Youth E’s leg and telling her
to not talk about her mother like that in front of the other youth.
Youth E reported Staff 2 did not hit her but touched her leg and
Staff 2 should not touch Youth E. Youth E stated she told a staff
about it but could not recall what staff. Youth E denied seeing any
staff yell at youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on March 18, 2024.
Staff 2 denied ever yelling at any youth or seeing another staff yell
at youth. Staff 2 stated there have not been any youth who ever
said anything to her about any staff yelling at youth. Staff 2
described being strict with youth and youth getting upset when
they get a loss of privilege (LOP). Staff 2 denied ever telling a
youth they were acting “childish.”
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There were no disciplinary records.
• Email from Youth A’s Foster Care Worker dated 3/19/2024,
Foster Care Worker did not indicate having any concerns
with staff’s interactions with youth at the facility.
• Email from Youth B’s Foster Care Worker dated 3/12/2024
stating she has no concerns at all with the facility.
6

• Incident Report dated 9/27/23 between Youth A and Staff 2
in the van consistent with Youth A’s interview.
• Girlstown Policy outlining Professional Conduct and Non-
Harassment/Non-Discrimination Policy indicates the facility
is committed to a work environment in which all individuals
are treated with respect and dignity. The policy further
states employees should be respectful, courteous, and
mindful of others.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as interviews with staff and all
the youths residing at the facility did not report staff yelling at
youth or talking inappropriately.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
